location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

physicalDescription.extent: The papers are arranged in rough chronological order from the front to the rear of the file.

Foliation: the foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the front cover with 1, and terminates at the inside back cover with 18; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio. A previous foliation sequence, which is also circled, has been superseded and therefore crossed out.

mods.abstract: This file is comprised of correspondence concerning British and American proposals relating to the continental shelf of the Gulf and offshore oil.The file includes correspondence (ff 11-17) from the British Embassy, Washington to the Foreign Office, London, discussing the issues of sovereignty in connection with the waters of the Persian Gulf.The other correspondents are the Eastern Department, Foreign Office, London; the Political Resident in the Persian Gulf; and the Political Agent, Muscat.
